graph.packing

Class GRASPPacker

  • java.lang.Object
    • graph.packing.GRASPPacker

  • public final class GRASPPacker
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements a fast GRASP algorithm for the 1- or 2-packing problem, well-known combinatorial optimization problems. In the first case, node-weights are allowed, so the problem is really the maximum weighted independent set. Allows for Local-Search algorithms to kick-in after a solution has been constructed.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

            throws ParallelException
        constructs an instance of the GRASPPacker algorithm. The Graph g passed in is not copied, but only a reference to the passed object stored.
        Parameters:

      • pack

        public java.util.Set pack(java.util.Set addfirstfrom)
                   throws PackingException,
                          ParallelException
        create a dist-_k packing for Graph _g via a GRASP method and return it as a Set of the active nodes.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Set // Set
        Throws:
        PackingException
        ParallelException

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws ParallelException
        invoke as java -cp <classpath> graph.packing.GRASPPacker <graph_file> <k> [numinitnodes] [numiterations] [do_local_search] [dls_num_threads] [max_allowed_time(ms)]. The graph_file contains the graph in the format specified in the comments of method utils.DataMgr.readGraphFromFile2(filename) and the numinitnodes is an optional number specifying how many (non-conflicting) nodes to choose randomly as an initial seed-set to grow from (default is zero). The solution found is written in the file "sol.out" in the current directory. It contains one line for each node included in the solution, and the line has the internal id of the node +1 (so the range of nodes is [1,...Graph.getNumNodes()].
        Parameters:
        args - String[] are as follows: args[0] graph_file_name mandatory, the name of the file containing the graph args[1] k mandatory, must be 1 or 2, describing the type of the problem args[2] numinitnodes optional, if present describes the cardinality of an initial random population from which to attempt to construct a first partial solution, Default is 0. args[3] numiterations optional, if present describes the number of major outer iterations to run. Default is 1. args[4] do_local_search optional, if "true" implies a local search via the popt4jlib.LocalSearch.DLS algorithm to be performed when a solution is constructed in a major outer iteration. Default is false. args[5] num_dls_threads optional, if present describes the number of threads to use in the DLS procedure if activated. Default is 1. args[6] max_allowed_time optional, if present, sets the max. allowed time for the process to run (in milliseconds). Default is +infinity.
        Throws:
        ParallelException
